history.content:
Hi everyone!


We’re the Undergraduate Group for Theoretical Computer Science (UGTCS), a student organization dedicated to building a community for undergraduates interested in theoretical computer science.


Are you enjoying CS161? Do you want to learn more about the theory behind different fields of Computer Science?
UGTCS is the place to be! Students of all academic backgrounds and experience levels are welcome.


This semester our reading group will be focused on Special Topics in Cryptography! We will talk about basics of cryptography, then fun topics like Zero Knowledge, Interactive Proofs, Probabilistically Checkable Proofs, Multiparty Computation, Differential Privacy, and more! A tentative syllabus is available here. Come explore the foundations of modern cryptography and get a taste of the latest developments in the field.


Interested?


1. Fill out our interest form!
2. Come out to our general meeting next Monday, 1/31 from 7 PM–9 PM in Cory 521.
For more info about us and what we do, check out our website at https://ugtcs.berkeley.edu
history.subject: Join UGTCS for a Special Topics in Cryptography Reading Group!
